<h1>GC Perf Report</h1>
======================================================== <br>

Generated: ```r.date ``` <br>
RunID : ```r.version ``` <br>



```{r, echo = FALSE, cache=FALSE}

source('R/constants.R')
source('R/utils.R')
source('R/functions.R')
source('R/style.R')
library(xtable)
library(ggplot2)
#suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(googleVis))
```



```{r2, echo = FALSE, cache=FALSE}




data.gc <- read.csv(data.file,sep=',', header=TRUE)

plotGC2 <- function (data.gc) {
  main_title="GC Timeline"
  qplot(timestamp,pause.time, main = main_title, data=data.gc, colour = gc.type)
}

histo2 <- function(data.gc) {
  main_title="PauseTime Histogram"
  #ggplot(data.gc, aes(x = pause.time)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.25, fill = aes(colour = gc.type))
  ggplot(data.gc, main = main_title, aes(x=pause.time, fill = gc.type)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.25,alpha = 0.5, position = "identity")
}
```



<h4>Summary</h4>
```{r kable,results="asis", echo = FALSE}
df <-statsMain(data.gc)
tab <- xtable(summary(df))
print(tab, type="html")
```


<h4>GC stats by type:</h4>
```{r xtable, results="asis", echo = FALSE}
df <-statsByGCType(data.gc)

tab <- xtable(summary(df))
print(tab, type="html")
```

<h4>GC Timeline</h4>
You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r fig.width=15, fig.height=6, echo = FALSE}
plotGC2(data.gc)
```

<h4>Histogram</h4>>

```{r fig.width=10, fig.height=6, echo = FALSE}
histo2(data.gc)
```


```{r fig.width=10, fig.height=6, echo = FALSE}
A1 <- gvisAnnotatedTimeLine(data.gc, datevar="timestamp",
                           numvar="gc.pause", idvar="Device",
                           titlevar="Title", annotationvar="Annotation",
                           )
print(A1, 'chart')
```
